qas.question: To which dynasty did Yarolav's step mother belong to?
Which three countried did Yaroslav's daughters become queens of?

answers.text: daughters of a Polish king and a Byzantine emperor

qas.question: What did not play an important role in European politics?
Whose stepmother did not belong to a Macedonian dynasty?
Who was not the greatest ruler of Byzantium?
Which countries did Yaroslav's sons become kings of?

plausible_answers.text: daughters of a Polish king and a Byzantine emperor

qas.question: Who did Yaroslav's sons not marry?

context: <b3_0>Kievan Rus<b3_0/>' also played an important genealogical role in European politics. <b4_0><b5_0>Yaroslav the Wise<b5_0/><b4_0/>, whose stepmother belonged to the <a0_0>Macedonian dynasty<a0_0/>, the greatest one to rule Byzantium, married the only legitimate daughter of the king who Christianized Sweden. His daughters became queens of <a1_0><b6_0>Hungary, France and Norway<b6_0/><a1_0/>, his sons married the <a2_0><b7_0>daughters of a Polish king and a Byzantine emperor<b7_0/><a2_0/> (not to mention a niece of the Pope), while his granddaughters were a German Empress and (according to one theory) the queen of Scotland. A grandson married the only daughter of the last Anglo-Saxon king of England. Thus the Rurikids were a well-connected royal family of the time.
